detaileddescription.para: Minimum of three values: a, b, c
Maximum of three values: a, b, c

memberdef.argsstring: (T a, T b, T c, T d)
memberdef.name: MIN4

detaileddescription.para: Minimum of four values: a, b, c, d

memberdef.argsstring: (T a, T b, T c, T d)
memberdef.name: MAX4

detaileddescription.para: Maximum of four values: a, b, c, d
Largest integer that is smaller than or equal to 'a'
Smallest integer that is bigger than or equal to 'a'
Take binary sign of 'a' (either -1, or 1 if >= 0)
Clamp the input to the specified range
Safe arc cosine of 'x' (acos() returns NaN if x<-1 or x>1)
Bilinear interpolation between four float values using 's' and 't' (0<=st<=1)
Bicubic Hermite interpolation between four float values using 's' and 't' (0<=st<=1)
Linearly interpolated step from 'lo' to 'hi'. Returns x where (0 <= x <= 1). Similar to FILTERSTEP() but slightly different mode of calling
RenderMan's smoothstep() function. Returns 0 if (t < e0) or 1 if (t > e1) or a hermitian interpolation for (e0 < t < e1)
Basic data types and scalar operations
